summary:
Gordon is a highly experienced public health professional with 30 years of international experience in the fields of health system strengthening, governance, coordination, evaluation, programme planning, health service delivery and quality of care. 

His public health background includes expertise in maternal health, sexual and reproductive health, immunisation, communicable and non-communicable diseases. 

Gordon has held senior management positions across different sectors including governments, funding agencies, NGOs and the private sector in Latin America, Asia and Africa and has extensive team leader experience over the past 15 years on short-term assignments. 

Of note is his experience in fragile states and the implementation of Basic Packages of Health and the strengthening of Health Systems.

profile_positions.description:
Long Term Technical Support Assignments

DFID Kenya 2020 – 2024. Deputy Team Leader. Independent monitoring of the DESIP Family Planning programme. Responsible for the annual process evaluations and quarterly third-party monitoring and data verification of Implementing Partners. Specific focus on benchmarking of Value for Money inputs and outcomes.

Health Pooled Fund, South Sudan 2016–ongoing. Lead Technical Adviser. Providing a range of technical and managerial support, capacity-building and mentoring to the fund donors, Ministry of Health, Fund Manager and Implementing Partners

USAID Grant Management Solutions 2014-2016 Botswana, India, Malawi & Somalia. Sector Expert and Team Leader to support the strengthening of Global Fund Country Coordination Mechanisms including leading an Eligibility and Performance Assessment of the CCMs and developing specific roadmaps to ensure compliance with GFATM requirements.

DFID India 2010-2014. Monitoring and Evaluation Advisor for HIV/AIDS TAST programme. Provided technical support to the design, establishment and performance monitoring for TAST HIV prevention programme and to develop innovative responses to HIV prevention among Key Affected Populations. Continually assessed the impact, efficiency and effectiveness of projects funded under the HIV/AIDS Innovation Fund and provided extensive capacity building of CBOs.

Afghanistan Ministry of Health 2009-2012. International Advisor. Provided technical support and mentoring to senior health managers within MoH to deliver the Essential Package of Health Services. Significant support was provided to the planning and monitoring of delivery and subsequent analysis and use of data.

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for leading and managing HIV and harm reduction technical activities of HIV/AIDS Asia Regional Programme (HAARP) across six Asian countries (Burma/Myanmar, Cambodia, China, Laos, Philippines, Vietnam). Responsible for providing and managing technical support inputs to partner governments and country programmes to ensure the integration of harm reduction services into national systems with the greater involvement of affected communities in the planning and participation of all HAARP programmes. 

Accomplishments:
Established the Regional Technical Coordination Unit in Bangkok, responsible for the management of technical assistance to HAARP country programmes. 

Led the design and development of four country level service delivery harm reduction programmes in Cambodia, China, Laos and Vietnam.

Established linkages and coordination mechanisms with regional bodies such as the UN Regional Task Force on Injecting Drug Use and the Asian Network of People Who Use Drugs (ANPUD).

Provided support and technical advice to partner governments to develop management and coordination mechanisms within and across different ministries to ensure harmonisation within the public health system.
profile_positions.title: Senior Harm Reduction & HIV Advisor

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for managing the day-to-day operations and strategy of the Programme Management Office (PMO), providing leadership to a core team of 15 staff and pool of 35 technical consultants in addition to providing oversight to the commissioning, management and evaluation of DFID India’s Technical Cooperation portfolio available under the National AIDS Control Programme (NACP) II framework. 

Specific activities included the design of funding opportunities (including types of contract to be awarded), evaluating and contracting winning proposals, maintaining robust management and monitoring systems (programmatic and financial). Regular reporting to DFID and Government of India, including developing policy briefings and coordinating and supervising all dissemination and networking activities. A key role was representing DFID at all levels, including representation to the Indian National AIDS Control Organisation (NACO) and other key government and UN agencies.

Accomplishments:
Led the design and creation of a funding framework and related evaluation system to enhance and complement DFID’s contribution to NACP-II 

Successfully managed DFID’s portfolio of existing and new programmes and projects (total value of £29 million), implemented through a wide range of stakeholders including NGOs, UN, private sector and the Government of India, covering service delivery, research, social marketing and BCC/advocacy initiatives. The programme was delivered on budget and on schedule, supporting a total of 42 grants and contracts.

Led the design and creation of a “Challenge Fund” specifically designed to give NGOs and CBOs the opportunity to test innovative service delivery models.

Developed a learning and dissemination strategy to assist DFID policy development on HIV and AIDS
